titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Ward Murphey Canaday (1885-1976) was a prominent businessman and executive of Willys-Overland Motors. His wife, Mariam Coffin Canaday (1883-1974), was a poet, classical scholar, and patron of the arts. Their daughter, Doreen Canaday Spitzer (b. 1914), graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1936. Doreen Canaday Spitzer is the author of a family history entitled By One and One, which was published in 1984.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Canaday family papers. Materials include personal correspondence between Ward Murphey Canaday, Mariam Louise Coffin, and their daughter Doreen. There is also correspondence from extended family and friends. Additionally there are diaries, school papers, and materials relating to Greek War Relief efforts belonging to Mariam Coffin. The collection also includes letters from Doreen from 1932 to 1936 while she was a student at Bryn Mawr College.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Toledo: Ward M. Canaday papers.
